title: A Sketch Page of Hands
medium: black and white chalk with colored chalk
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Charles Antoine Coypel [1694-1752], Paris, France. M. de Bourguignon de Fabregoules, Aix-en-Provence, France, in early 19th century; transferred to M. Charles-Joseph-Barthélemi Giraud [1802-1882], Aix-en-Provence and Paris, France, ca. 1840 until ca. 1861; Prosper Flury-Hérard [1804-1873], Paris and Bures-sur-Yvette, France (Lugt 1015), in 1861 [1]; probably sale, Paris, France, May 13-15, 1861 [2]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by December 4, 1975 [3]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. Ceded by Giraud to the banker Flury-Hérard in lieu of repayment of debts. This drawing is stamped and inscribed in ink, lower right recto, F. H. No. 566 (Lugt 1015.) Provenance information on the origin of the Flury-Hérard collection is included in the 1921 Lugt edition. Further identification of the banker obtained from the Lugt entry 1015, revised November 2015 (accessed on-line.)
[2]. Sale entitled "Dessins anciens des maitres italiens, flamands, hollandais et français" (expert Blaisot.)  
[3]. Received at the museum on December 4, 1975.

creator.birth_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
